Title: Senior Data Scientist, Returns Optimization
RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $121,000 - 132,000. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. 
Must be ONSITE in Boston, MA (Monday-Thursday)
CastleGate is Wayfairs proprietary supply chain service that empowers suppliers to forward-position their inventory closer to customers, enabling fast, reliable, and cost-effective fulfillment. The CastleGate Product team is part of Wayfairs broader Network Management organization and is responsible for building and optimizing the CastleGate offering across our global network to ensure it creates value for Wayfair, our Suppliers and Customers.
We're seeking a passionate and skilled Data Scientist to be a core member of the team building our groundbreaking Returns Disposition Engine. In this role, you'll be instrumental in developing and deploying optimization models for the Wayfair returns process. You'll work with complex data to determine the best course of action for each returned item, balancing company, supplier, and customer interests. This is an opportunity to use your technical expertise to solve a critical business problem, directly impacting our operational efficiency, financial outcome and customer satisfaction. Successful individuals in this role excel at both qualitative and quantitative analysis while also being eager to communicate upward and outward to tell a concise story.  
What You'll Do

Leverage arithmetic, statistical, and ML approaches to establish a new profit max Returns Disposition Engine
Perform statistical analysis across large data sets and within defined segments to develop performance insights across a myriad of attributes
Create efficient data structures that can be leveraged across the organization and can be maintained in a dynamic environment
Collaborate with cross functional partners and ensure that there is strong alignment between Wayfairs business objectives and our Data Science driven strategies
Develop key metrics and reporting to measure how initiatives are improving Wayfairs performance and enabling our team to easily identify trends, root causes and develop targeted action plans
Conduct thorough ad-hoc analysis
Build prototypes and dashboards to translate large data sets into driving insights and action
Monitor KPIs and assess how were making progress against business objectives

What You'll Need 

Master's and/or Bachelors degree in a quantitative field
Professional experience in writing code in structured programming languages (Python, R), writing scripts using GBQ or SQL, creating Pivot Tables and Vlookups in Google Sheets or Excel, and using data visualization tools such as Data Studio, Looker, Tableau or PowerBI
Excellent communication, both written and verbally
Collaborative mindset that thrives as part of a team
Data and process-oriented, demonstrated ability to continuously learn new tools
High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously
Ability to navigate an environment of continuous improvement working through ambiguity in an evolving organization 

An Important Note about Wayfair's In-Office Policy:
All Boston-based interns, Co-ops, and corporate employees will be in office in a hybrid capacity. Employees will work in the office on designated days, Monday - Thursday, and work remotely Friday.

Title: Warehouse Supervisor
RoleDescription:
We are Wayfair; we deliver a best-in-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customers needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. Title: Senior Retail Designer, Cabinetry
RoleDescription:
Senior Retail Designer, Cabinetry
Location: 3232 Lake Ave Suite 1, Wilmette, IL 60091The entry pay for this position is $25/hr with uncapped quarterly bonus pay potential. Total compensation may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
Overview:At Wayfair, we believe a home should be as functional as it is beautiful and that starts with great design. As a Sr. Retail Designer of Cabinetry and Home Renovation, you'll turn customer visions into reality, guiding them through their renovation journey with confidence, creativity, and care. From kitchens and bathrooms to laundry rooms and custom built-ins, you'll craft smart, stylish spaces that reflect each customers goals, budget, and style.
Youll tap into your expertise in cabinetry, bath, and kitchen design. Youll lean into Wayfairs expansive product catalog from cabinetry and tile to flooring and plumbing to provide complete solutions for DIY homeowners and professional contractors alike. If you're a proactive problem-solver with a passion for design and sales, and you love seeing a great project come to life, this is your stage.
What Does A Cabinetry and Home Renovation Designer Do?

 Own the Design Process: Lead cabinetry and home renovation projects from concept to completion. Use 2020 Design Live or similar software to develop layout plans, renderings, and product recommendations based on customer inputs, measurements, and needs.
 Be the Technical Expert: Educate customers on cabinetry construction types (framed vs. frameless), materials (MDF, plywood, solid wood), finishes (painted, stained, laminated), and specialty features (soft-close hinges, pull-outs, and more).
 Deliver Personalized Consultations: Whether it's in-store, virtual, or in-home, you'll meet customers where they are. You'll listen deeply, learn their style and renovation goals, and recommend functional, beautiful solutions tailored to their timeline and budget.
 Connect the Dots from Start to Finish: Develop floor plans, mood boards, 3D visuals, and complete product packages. You'll manage each projects full lifecycle, from early design to final purchase, and offer support through post-order services to ensure a smooth renovation experience.
 Educate + Inspire: Stay ahead of design trends and new materials, bringing fresh ideas to every customer interaction. Help customers see how tile, flooring, kitchen, bath, and plumbing products can work together to create the space theyve dreamed of.
 Leverage Design + Sales Tools: Use analytics and digital tools to build persuasive space plans, presentations, and shopping experiences that help grow the business while putting your creativity to work.
 Thrive in a Dynamic Environment: With evolving customer needs, product assortments, and promotions, youll stay focused, flexible, and ready to pivotall while delivering high-impact experiences.
 Always Be Selling (ABS): Every interaction is an opportunity. Youll generate new leads, build customer rapport, and close on personalized solutions that help grow your pipeline and the stores performance.
 Contribute to Store Success: Help with visual updates, floor sets, and inventory tasks as needed and bring your ideas to the table! Were a team that builds (and wins) together.

 
Youll Thrive in this Role if You Have:

 Design Experience: 3+ years of experience in kitchen, bath, cabinetry, or home renovation design. You know your way around spatial planning, product selection, and what works (and what wows). Bonus points for 12 years focused on cabinetry.
 Technical Proficiency: Youre confident working in 2020 Design software. Familiarity with CRM/POS systems (like Salesforce) helps too.
 Sales Know-How: Youve got a track record of meeting or beating your sales goals and you know how to build trust while selling big ideas and beautiful designs.
 Flexible Schedule: Retail hours mean nights, weekends, and holidays. Youre ready to show up when your customers need you most.
 Educational Background: A Bachelors degree or college diploma in a related field is preferred, but your experience and design sensibility speak volumes.
 Leadership + Training Experience: If youve mentored or trained others in a retail or design setting, even better! You know how to lift up your team and lead by example.
 Professional Certification (Preferred): NKBA, NAHB, NARI, or KBDI certifications are a plus and help you stand out as a true renovation pro.
 End-to-End Product Knowledge: You bring the full package from cabinetry to tile and have the confidence to guide customers through every step.
 Collaborative Spirit: You thrive in a team-focused environment and take pride in supporting your peers just as much as your customers.
 Top-Notch Organization: Strong attention to detail, follow-through, and communication make you a trusted partner from consultation to completion.

Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements:

 Physical Activity: Frequent standing, walking, and reaching with hands and arms; occasional sitting, climbing, balancing, and crawling.
 Mobility & Movement: Frequent stooping, kneeling, and crouching throughout the day.
 Lifting Ability: Must be able to lift and/or move up to 50 lbs regularly.
 Vision Requirements: Includes close, distance, color, and peripheral vision; depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.
 Temperature Flexibility: Comfortable in environments with varying temperature conditions.
 Noise Tolerance: Occasional exposure to moderate noise levels and physical activity.
 Safety Awareness: Minimal exposure to workplace or environmental hazardsmust adhere to all safety protocols.

 
What are the Benefits*?

 Competitive Pay & Bonus: Earn competitive compensation with regular opportunities for performance-based increases and substantial quarterly bonus opportunity. 
 Career Growth: Access professional development and advancement opportunities to help you grow with us.
 Health Benefits from Day One: Medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage starts on your first day.
 Time to Recharge: Start accruing paid time off immediatelybecause work-life balance matters.
 401(k) with Company Match: Well match up to 4% to help you plan for your future.
 Tuition Reimbursement: Eligible after 6 months of employmentlearn, grow, and get support along the way.
 Wayfair Employee Discount: Save big on the pieces you loveplus get 10% off at our in-store restaurant .
 Parental Leave Options: Choose from paid and unpaid leave plans to support your growing family.
 And So Much More: Weve got more good stuff where that came from! NOTE: our full-time roles receive the full benefits package above, while part-time or seasonal team members may have modified offerings. Your recruiter or in-store team can help with any questions!

Title: Operations Manager - EU Freight
RoleDescription:
Office Based: Lutterworth Magna ParkHours: 40 hours per week, Monday to Friday
Salary: The salary range for this position is 68,000 - 75,750 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will be provided as part of the compensation package.
Company Benefits: Wayfair Employee Discount, Private Medical Care, Dental Care, Gym Membership,  Tuition Reimbursement, 25 Days starting Holiday (with tenure entitlement) + Bank Holidays, Pension, Cycle to Work scheme amongst others.
Revolutionise global freight operations and lead the charge in optimising Wayfair's logistics! 
CastleGate Forwarding (CGF) is a rapidly growing digital freight forwarding startup within Wayfair. We're dedicated to moving containers globally, from Wayfair suppliers to our shelves and beyond. We provide a full suite of shipping services, including consolidation in Asia, ocean freight, drayage, customs brokerage, and cargo insurance. Our goal is to offer Wayfair suppliers efficient and competitive logistics solutions. We leverage our proprietary end-to-end logistics network to enhance speed, quality, and cost efficiency.
As an Operations Manager will be a key leader in our organization, responsible for steering the team that manages and optimizes our inbound freight operations and procurement strategy. Your primary focus will be to oversee carrier relationships, negotiate contracts, and improve operational efficiencies. You will be instrumental in driving cost savings and ensuring we consistently deliver high service levels. This role requires exceptional leadership, analytical problem-solving abilities, and a strategic approach to enhance transportation and procurement performance in the European market.
What Youll Do:
Leadership & Strategy

Manage a team of logistics professionals, providing coaching and career development.
Drive operational excellence by owning financial performance and executing strategic initiatives to enhance efficiency and reduce costs.
Collaborate with key stakeholders across departments to ensure operational success and service quality.

Freight Forwarding & Carrier Management

Develop and implement carrier strategies for inbound freight to ensure both cost-effectiveness and reliability. Stay current on market trends, pricing, and new logistics solutions to maintain a competitive edge.
Continuously track and improve carrier performance using key metrics like cost, transit times, and service levels.
Manage and lead the negotiation of contracts and service level agreements with drayage providers.

Procurement & Vendor Management

Oversee the entire procurement process, including vendor selection, contract negotiation, and risk mitigation related to supplier reliability and cost volatility.
Develop and maintain strong, long-term partnerships with carriers to ensure competitive pricing and a reliable supply chain.
Implement systems to track costs and measure performance, driving continuous improvement in the procurement process.

Technology & Process Optimization

Partner with Technology and Business Intelligence teams to utilize data, automation, and reporting tools.
Create and deploy carrier and procurement dashboards to track performance and pinpoint areas for improvement, while also standardizing and automating processes to enhance efficiency.

What You Bring:

Demonstrable experience in logistics, supply chain or operations management, with a track record of successfully managing carrier partnerships and performance.
Proven experience managing and developing teams, with a focus on fostering a high-performance culture.
Analytical and data-driven mindset, with the ability to translate insights into actionable strategies 
Excellent problem-solving and decision-making skills, with a structured approach to tackling operational challenges.
Proven ability in negotiation and vendor management, adept at resolving complex issues and fostering collaborative relationships that drive mutual success.
Proficiency in Google or Microsoft Suite and data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio, Looker, Tableau or Power BI. Any SQL/GBQ knowledge is a plus.
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, with experience leading cross-functional initiatives.

Additional Requirements 

Have the flexibility of regular travel to our London office at least once a month.

Although Logistics, supply chain, or operations management experience is essential, any additional knowledge of procurement, freight forwarding, drayage, or ocean carrier management would be a plus. 
Ready to take the next step? Hit apply and lets talk - our recruiting team is excited to hear from you!

RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.

The Identity & Access Engineering team is responsible for building solutions to effectively orchestrate user account lifecycles, ensure seamless authentication for internal and external applications, and facilitate user access requests. We lean heavily on automation to create scalable solutions that help the CyberSecurity team fulfill its mission of security by design. Were currently looking for an innovative and creative Engineer to help our team build new services focused on automation and maintain and improve current solutions. Stay abreast of IAM industry best practices and new solutions (including open source and off the shelf products) to help improve our patterns and tech stack

Experience using Hashicorp stack (Terraform & Vault), Elastic Stack (Kibana & Elasticsearch), and Docker

Title: Senior Analyst - Freight Logistics Operations
RoleDescription:
Wayfair is redefining the way goods move around the world through a vertically integrated and differentiated supply chain. To enable this experience, Wayfair has created CastleGate Forwarding, our proprietary end-to-end logistics network that moves containers across the globe to our warehouses and beyond. This is an exciting, fast-paced, and high-visibility initiative - we are seeking team members to disrupt the status quo and redefine the freight forwarding business.
We are seeking a Senior Analyst, Freight Operations to join our Asia-based team. This high-impact role requires a strong analytical mindset, operational excellence, and the ability to collaborate across internal teams and external partners. Your work will directly shape efficiency, reliability, and scalability in a complex and sophisticated global supply chain.
As a Senior Analyst, you will play a critical role in shaping the efficiency, reliability, and scalability of a sophisticated global supply chain. You will bring expertise in freight forwarding  particularly in origin warehouse consolidation and data-driven decision-making  to optimize operations. The successful candidate will be comfortable with quantitative analysis, qualitative insights, and strategic communication, turning complex findings into clear, actionable recommendations for stakeholders at all levels.
 
What Youll Do:

Generate Insights & Drive Decisions: Translate large, complex data sets into actionable recommendations that improve operational performance, reliability, and customer satisfaction.
Design Scalable Tools & Reporting Dashboards: Build automated dashboards and reporting solutions to empower stakeholders with data-driven insights.
Optimize Freight Operations: Analyze KPIs, identify trends, and recommend process improvements to enhance speed, cost efficiency, and service levels. Actively integrate data, leveraging analytics to scope and implement levers to drive speed & reliability globally, and create monitoring tools to track progress.
Lead Strategic Projects: Own end-to-end freight-forwarding initiatives  from conceptualization, to planning, execution, and measurement  focused on reducing incident rates and improving performance.
Collaborate Across Functions: Be an effective contributor in a team that manages multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment - partner with global operations, technology, and supplier teams to design and deliver process transformations.
Enhance Performance Frameworks: Develop and implement sustainable performance management models that enable long-term improvements across supply chain processes.

What You'll Need:

Analytical & Technical Competency: Advanced proficiency in SQL/BigQuery, Excel/Google Sheets, and visualization tools (Looker, Tableau, PowerBI, or Google Data Studio). Proficiency in Google Suite and Microsoft Office. 
Work Experience: Strong background in logistics, supply chain, or freight forwarding preferred; knowledge of warehouse consolidation a plus. Proven success operating within an analytical focused role providing agile business insights for impactful business decisions. Ideally, within an operational/ supply chain environment.
Leadership & Execution: Proven ability to manage projects in fast-paced, high-priority environments with a track record of achieving quantifiable results. Aptitude to effectively navigate IT systems and multiple applications simultaneously.
Communication: Strong written and verbal skills; ability to translate complex data into concise, actionable narratives.
Mindset & Soft Skills: Entrepreneurial, independent, adaptable, collaborative, comfortable with ambiguity and customer-focused with a passion for process optimization.
Qualifications: Bachelors degree in a quantitative field (supply chain preferred). Fluency in English & Mandarin required.
Travel Requirements: Accommodate occasional travel to warehouse locations in China, India and Southeast Asia.

Title: CastleGate Inbound, Operations Services Associate
RoleDescription:
The CastleGate Inbound, Operations Services Associate role is part of our Global Partner Support Inbound team. As a member of GPS Inbound you will work with internal teams and our Fulfillment Centers to provide best in class support to our suppliers that are shipping items to ports and onto our Wayfair Facilities, known as CastleGate. Triage tickets to understand if it needs to be routed to other internal teams or escalated to our Tier II team.
Identify areas of opportunity within our SOPs. 
Meet deadlines and SLAs, proactively adjusting, learning, and communicating when roadblocks are encountered or new information becomes available

Associates degree or equivalent military/work experience
Skill at time management and prioritization, working well under tight SLAs

Analytical, creative, and innovative approach to solving problems
Strong organization skills and attention to detail
Ability to work effectively with people in a cross-functional environment
Confidence as a self-starter, able to work with limited supervision
Passion for solving complex business problems 
Experience with collaborative G Suite tools or their Microsoft/Open Office equivalents
Adaptability to constant evolution of workload, processes and expectations
Ability to learn new systems and processes quickly 
Must be able to consider multiple approaches and not be limited by how things were done historically 
Experience working with our CastleGate Inbound network or inbound shipments a plus

Title: Production Planning Manager
RoleDescription:
Production Planning Manager 
 
Compensation: The salary range for this position is $119,202.00- $132,446.50per year . The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will be provided as part of the compensation package.
The Workflow Controller plays a vital role in staffing, planning, and achieving site specific goals across Wayfair's Fulfillment Network. They work to ensure the accurate, timely, and cost efficient processing of the perfect order to our customers.
What You'll Do

You will create daily operating plans for a site and resolve variances between plan, actuals, and goals. Responsible for building plans at this cadence to align with Site Director and network priorities
Act as the site labor planning champion, taking full ownership of all labor planning inputs such as headcount, UPH for each process path, flow paths, absenteeism, attrition and product mix and determine the labor capacity needed across each process path on a daily and weekly basis to achieve business objectives
Develop a system for risk management based on demand and capacity of Critical Pull Times (CPTs) for customer orders; proactively monitor risk and recommend actions to Operations team to mitigate risk
You will monitor plans and work in process backlogs to consider impacts of future planning and staffing
You will provide input to strategic shift planning at the site to ensure the building is staffed according to mid-long term volume projections
Coordinate with local site operations and central planning teams to analyze historical data and forecast demand for that site
Manage and interpret the analyses of daily, weekly, and monthly reporting of site performance via Key Performance Indicators (Service Level Commitments)

Title: Data Scientist II, Customer Technology
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements. 
Wayfair Data Science is the engine that powers an enterprise obsessed with data. The Wayfair websites generate over 100M clicks from the millions of customers that visit our sites every day to discover and purchase home goods. The Customer Tech Data Science team is focused on understanding and optimizing customer behavior on the website and mobile application as a key enabler for the company to move fast and iterate quickly on big business problems.
At their core, the Customer Tech Data Science team at Wayfair are strong in quantitative analysis, enjoy coding but also want to balance that with their interest in business and applying advanced modeling techniques. They think critically to tackle complex challenges, thrive in a fast-paced environment and are seeking a high-growth opportunity where they will have an immediate impact on day one. There are significant opportunities for new team members to emerge as leaders, taking on additional projects and responsibilities with strong performance.
What Youll Do:
As a Data Scientist, youll play a critical role in uncovering insights that shape strategic decisions and improve business performance. You will explore data trends, diagnose gaps, and identify growth & innovation opportunities across Wayfairs data. Your work will directly impact how the company understands performance and makes data-informed decisions.

Conduct in-depth analysis across large-scale datasets (clickstream, sales, product, logistics, and customer data) to uncover trends, gaps, and business opportunities.
Champion the use of emerging technologies - including GenAI and LLMs - to transform how we explore data and uncover insights, unlocking new ways to accelerate analysis, automate complex workflows, and make insights more accessible and actionable across the business.
Become a subject matter expert on key business metrics and customer behavior, ensuring accurate interpretation and analysis.
Drive innovation in business analysis by adopting and implementing new methodologies (e.g., key driver analysis, anomaly detection, forecasting, cohorting).
Establish robust KPI tracking and anomaly detection systems to ensure early identification of emerging issues and opportunities.
Collaborate with cross-functional partnersincluding Business Strategy, Product, and Engineeringto uncover actionable insights that drive growth and improve customer experience.
Design, run, and interpret A/B tests to make high-impact changes to the customer experience.
Build, automate, and maintain scalable dashboards and reports using tools like Looker, BigQuery (GBQ), SQL and Python to enable efficient and self-serve data access for stakeholders.
Develop optimized and maintainable code pipelines to transform multi-terabyte data into meaningful business insights and recommendations.

What You'll Need:

Bachelors in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Information Systems, Economics, or other quantitative discipline; Masters preferred.
3 - 5 years of work experience in a relevant field, such as analytics or data science.
Proficient knowledge of a statistical programming language such as Python, R, SAS, or SPSS.
Proficient knowledge of SQL (incl. Aggregate functions, joins, etc.).
Experience conducting quantitative analyses on large and complex data sets.
Experience in leveraging modeling algorithms to derive business insights.
Experience with experimental test design such as A/B testing.
Experience with data visualization software (e.g. Google Data Studio, Tableau, PowerBI); experience with Looker a plus.
Analytical, creative, and innovative approach to solving problems.
Strong written and verbal communication.
Ecommerce or retail analytics experience is a plus.
